summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office to Judge Kenneth M. Karas regarding the defense's request for video footage from outside Nicholas Tartaglione's cell at the MCC on July 22-23, 2019. The government reports that the MCC inadvertently preserved video from the wrong cell tier, and the requested video of the cell Tartaglione shared with Jeffrey Epstein no longer exists due to technical errors on a backup system.

persons.name: Kenneth M. Karas
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case United States v. Nicholas Tartaglione, to whom this government update letter is addressed.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (S4 16 Cr. 832 (KMK)), who shared a cell with Jeffrey Epstein at the MCC. His defense counsel requested video footage from outside his cell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The high-profile inmate who shared a cell (Cell-1) with defendant Nicholas Tartaglione at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). Corrections officers responded to their cell on July 23, 2019.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who respectfully submits this letter to the court.

connections.description: They shared a cell (designated Cell-1) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). Corrections officers responded to their cell in the early hours of July 23, 2019.

events.title: MCC Response to Tartaglione/Epstein Cell
events.description: At approximately 1:27 a.m., Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) corrections officers responded to Cell-1, which was shared by defendant Nicholas Tartaglione and Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Defense Request for Video Preservation
events.description: Defense counsel for Nicholas Tartaglione requested that the MCC preserve video footage from outside the defendant's cell from July 22, 2019, at 11:00 p.m. through July 23, 2019, at 4:00 a.m.

events.title: Government Receives Wrong Video
events.description: The MCC provided the government with a copy of the video it had preserved. Upon review, the government determined it was footage from the wrong cell tier (Cell-2) and not from the tier containing Cell-1 where Tartaglione and Epstein were housed.

locations: United States Courthouse, 300 Quarropas Street, White Plains, New York 10601
keyFacts: The MCC inadvertently preserved video footage from the wrong cell tier (Cell-2) instead of the tier containing Cell-1 where Nicholas Tartaglione and Jeffrey Epstein were housed on July 22-23, 2019.

The requested video footage from outside Tartaglione and Epstein's cell no longer exists; a backup system review by the FBI determined it was lost due to technical errors and had not existed since at least August 2019.
Corrections officers responded to Cell-1, shared by Tartaglione and Epstein, at approximately 1:27 a.m. on July 23, 2019.

The government's letter is an update to the court regarding the defense's inability to obtain the requested surveillance video, which is relevant to the events surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's time in custody.
